body:
[GitHub repositories](http://github.com/erwbgy/)

Linux Puppet modules:

* [anthillpro](http://erwbgy.github.com/puppet-anthillpro): install and configure an Anthill Pro agent
* [autohome](http://erwbgy.github.com/puppet-autohome): configure automounted home directories
* [iptables](http://erwbgy.github.com/puppet-iptables/): manage iptables incoming rules
* [limits](http://erwbgy.github.com/puppet-limits/): set entries in /etc/security/limits.conf
* [pamldap](http://erwbgy.github.com/puppet-pamldap/): configure LDAP host user authentication, authorisation and name resolution
* [ntp](http://erwbgy.github.com/puppet-ntp/): manage the Network Time Server daemon (ntpd) on a Linux host 
* [pdns](http://erwbgy.github.com/puppet-pdns/): manage a PowerDNS namserver or resolver, with support for running internal domains
* [runit](http://erwbgy.github.com/puppet-runit/): manage Runit user services
* [ssh](http://erwbgy.github.com/puppet-ssh): manage SSH host and user access
* [sunjdk](http://erwbgy.github.com/puppet-sunjdk/): install the Sun (Oracle) JDK from a tarball
* [system](http://erwbgy.github.com/puppet-system/): manage Linux system resources and services from hiera configuration

Middleware Puppet modules:

* [jboss](https://github.com/erwbgy/puppet-jboss): Install and run JBoss under Runit
* [tomcat](https://github.com/erwbgy/puppet-tomcat): Install and run Apache Tomcat under Runit
* [weblogic](https://github.com/erwbgy/puppet-weblogic): Install Weblogic (optionally with SOA and OSB)
* [wso2](https://github.com/erwbgy/puppet-wso2): Install and run WSO2 products (like ESB and Identity Server)

Many of these have been released and are available on [Puppet Forge](http://forge.puppetlabs.com/users/erwbgy).
